extra.description:
A set of one or more arbitrary metadata key and value pairs for the
chassis.

created_at.description:
The date and time when the resource was created.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, is the time zone as an offset
from UTC.

extra.description:
A set of zero or more arbitrary metadata key and value pairs for
the chassis.

links.description: A list that contains a self link and associated chassis links.

nodes.description: Links to the collection of nodes contained in this chassis.

updated_at.description:
The date and time when the resource was updated.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, is the time zone as an offset
from UTC. In the previous example, the offset value is ``-05:00``.

If the ``updated_at`` date and time stamp is not set, its value is
``null``.

the chassis.

parameters.description:
Requests a page size of items. Returns a number of items up to a
limit value. Use the ``limit`` parameter to make an initial limited
request and use the ID of the last-seen item from the response as
the ``marker`` parameter value in a subsequent limited request.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The ID of the last-seen item. Use the ``limit`` parameter to make
an initial limited request and use the ID of the last-seen item
from the response as the ``marker`` parameter value in a subsequent
limited request.
parameters.name: marker

parameters.description:
Sorts the response by the requested sort direction. A valid value
is ``asc`` (ascending) or ``desc`` (descending). Default is
``asc``. You can specify multiple pairs of sort key and sort
direction query parameters. If you omit the sort direction in a
pair, the API uses the natural sorting direction of the server
attribute that is provided as the ``sort_key``.
parameters.name: sort_dir

parameters.description:
Sorts the response by the this attribute value. Default is ``id``.
You can specify multiple pairs of sort key and sort direction query
parameters. If you omit the sort direction in a pair, the API uses
the natural sorting direction of the server attribute that is
provided as the ``sort_key``.
parameters.name: sort_key

parameters.description:
One or more chassis fields to be returned in the response.

For example, the following request returns only the ``description``
field for each chassis:

::

   GET /v1/chassis?fields=description
parameters.name: fields
